text: WTV: A Deep-Value ETF With A Broad And Conservative Exposure (Rating Downgrade). WisdomTree U.S. Value Fund (WTV) offers a defensive, value-focused portfolio with a notably low 12.3x forward P/E and broad market-cap exposure. WTV has shifted toward larger, more defensive sectors, underweighting technology and overweighting financials, consumer staples, and energy relative to the Russell 1000. Despite lagging the Russell 1000 in recent years, WTV has outperformed value peers in both 3- and 5-year windows, excelling in bullish markets.
label: negative

text: TSMC Is Relentlessly Getting Stronger, And The Market Is Mispricing It. TSM is rapidly gaining foundry market share and now has a credible path to high 40s, or even 50%, 5‑year revenue CAGR, helped by Nvidia's incremental H200 demand for China shipments. TSM's 2026 price hikes and better‑than‑expected 2nm yields support a plausible new gross margin plateau above 60% from Q4 FY25 onward. TSM is accelerating its second Arizona fab, with 3nm production now targeted for 2027 instead of 2028, pulling forward advanced‑node US revenue.
label: positive

text: Michelin: Buyback Support And Structural Tailwinds Reinforce The Long-Term Case. Michelin remains rated Buy, supported by strong fundamentals, capital allocation flexibility, and upside as industry cycles normalize. Key drivers include an aging vehicle parc and a new upside: heavier electrified powertrains will likely accelerate tyre wear and innovation across divisions, supporting volume and margin growth. Share buybacks (~€400M) provided technical support; future capital allocation signals, including potential M&A, are expected at the FY25 update in February.
label: positive

text: XME: Strong Price Momentum Meets Bullish 2026 Global Fundamentals (Rating Upgrade). State Street SPDR S&P Metals & Mining ETF (XME) is upgraded to buy after a 96% YoY rally and improved valuation metrics. XME's P/E has dropped to 15.4x, with anticipated long-term EPS growth above 26%, making the PEG ratio highly attractive. The ETF's equal-weighted structure and small-cap tilt add risk, but no single holding dominates, and liquidity has surged.
label: positive

text: Okta: The Agentic AI Opportunity No One Is Talking About (Rating Upgrade). Okta is upgraded to a buy as growth expectations have reset and agentic AI offers a compelling new catalyst. OKTA delivered 12% YoY revenue growth, robust cRPOs, expanding GAAP profitability, and maintains a strong net cash balance sheet. Management sees agentic AI as a potentially larger TAM than current workforce and customer identity markets combined.

text: TPG Mortgage Investment Trust: Coverage Of The Higher Dividend Should Improve In 2026. TPG Mortgage Investment Trust, previously known as AG Mortgage Investment Trust, has recently increased its dividend following an improvement in underlying profitability. While MITT's payout relative to Q3 2025 distributable earnings now stands at 100%, I see the payout dipping below 95% in 2026 as the Fed finalizes its policy normalization. Aside from an attractive current yield, the shares also trade at a circa 18% book value discount, providing a margin of safety as well as capital gain potential.

text: BMEZ: Deep Discount Once Again Makes It An Interesting Play. BlackRock Health Sciences Term Trust (BMEZ) now trades at a compelling 12% discount, offering a potential entry for investors seeking relatively volatile healthcare exposure. BMEZ removed its options writing strategy, increasing reliance on capital appreciation from its biotech-tilted, growth-oriented portfolio for both returns and distribution coverage. The fund's distribution was cut from a 12% managed rate to a more sustainable payout level, with payouts primarily reliant on capital gains rather than income.

text: DYNF: Performance Improvement Secures A Rating Upgrade. The iShares U.S. Equity Factor Rotation Active ETF rotates between style factors, including value, growth, quality, size, momentum, and minimum volatility. Despite having a relatively weak start, DYNF has beaten IVV for three consecutive years, validating its strategy's ability to deliver durable alpha in a bull market. Its impressive performance, together with the GARP tilt (i.e., a PEG ratio of 1.01), secures a rating upgrade to a Buy.
label: positive

text: BBLU: Revisiting EA Bridgeway's Active Blue-Chip Core ETF. BBLU is recently reorganized actively managed blue-chip ETF with a history dating back to July 1997. Returns of its predecessor mutual fund indicate long-term outperformance over S&P 500 Index ETFs. BBLU and SPY have strikingly similar return profiles despite BBLU holding just 36 equities, suggesting its four managers are extremely skilled at identifying the key stocks that drive markets. BBLU features a consistently lower portfolio beta, though its growth and value mix is slightly unfavorable - a reversal from my review from about two years ago.
label: negative

text: VTEX: Despite Macro Challenges, A Great Price For FCF Growth. VTEX (VTEX), a Brazilian e-commerce platform, offers compelling value after a 40% share price decline and remains a Buy amid macro headwinds. VTEX combines blue-chip customers, international expansion, disciplined opex, and positive FCF margins, despite recent deceleration in revenue and GMV growth. Q3 results showed 6% y/y revenue growth and 13% y/y GMV growth, with guidance trimmed to 9.3–10.7% FX-neutral growth for the year.

text: Why To Own Verizon Communications In 2026. Verizon Communications Inc. (VZ) remains a compelling buy for dividend-focused investors, supported by robust free cash flow and a 6.7% yield. Balance sheet improvements include reducing total debt to $146.8B and net secured debt/EBITDA to 2.2x, enhancing liquidity in an uncertain rate environment.
